intro: Ivesia mutabilis, commonly known as the variable ivesia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Rosaceae family and is characterized by its showy, pink to white flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils, often in open woodlands or along streambanks. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and have a serrated margin, while its stems are often hairy. Ivesia mutabilis is also known for its ability to thrive in arid environments, making it a hardy and adaptable species.
